hero.description: Developer passionate about creating intuitive and user-centric digital experiences. Focused on building modern web applications with clean architecture and pixel-perfect designs. Always eager to learn and embrace new challenges.

experience.title: Experience
experience.achievement1: Develop a web application built with Django (Python) to replace the OpenWrt admin interface on a Raspberry Pi, featuring an interactive network scanner with real-time display of connected devices.
experience.achievement2: Develop a web application designed to optimize delivery drivers routes by automating delivery tracking and validation. Developed using Symfony (versions 3.4 and 5.4), PHP, JavaScript, Bootstrap, and MySQL.

degree1.title: 2-year Technical Degree (Higher Technician's Certificate)

degree2.description: Certified digital proficiency in various domains

degree4.title: Cybersecurity MOOC
degree4.description: Introductory training focused on cybersecurity principles, best practices in digital safety, and risk prevention strategies for individuals and organizations.

degree5.title: Introduction to Game Development Certificate (25 ECTS)
degree5.description: Comprehensive course covering the fundamentals of game design and development, including game engines, programming logic, 2D/3D graphics, and gameplay mechanics.

portfolio.title: PORTFOLIO
portfolio.description: Personal portfolio website built with Vue.js 3 and TailwindCSS for the styling, featuring responsive design, project showcase, and modern UI components. Demonstrates proficiency in frontend development.

merlin.title: Merlin's Demon War
merlin.description: Merlin's Demon War is a turn-based combat card game developed in Unity, showcasing gameplay logic, UI design, and asset integration. The game was built as part of a university course at XAMK, emphasizing object-oriented programming and component-based architecture.

snake.title: Mobile Snake Game
snake.description: This project is a classic Snake game developed for Android devices using the Unity game engine. It was created as part of the "Introduction to Video Games Creation" course offered by XAMK University, focusing on mobile game development fundamentals

return.title: The Return
return.description: The Return is a narrative-driven, text-based adventure game developed using the Unity game engine. Created as part of a university course at XAMK, this project emphasizes storytelling, player choice, and state management within a minimalist interface

gsb.title: GSB
gsb.description: GSB is a PHP/MySQL-based web application designed to streamline the monthly reimbursement process for medical representatives. Built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap on the frontend, and PHP (with PDO) on the backend, it enables users to securely log in, submit expense claims, upload supporting documents, and track reimbursement status. Accountants validate and manage entries via a dedicated interface. The application replicates a real-world expense cycle with automated month closure, validation logic, and historical tracking—all hosted on an Apache server via WAMP
